articles.author: ABBY SEWELL
articles.description: BEIRUT (AP) — Two back-to-back strikes in Beirut and Tehran, both attributed to Israel and targeting high-ranking figures in Hamas and Hezbollah, have left Hezbollah and Iran in a quandary.
articles.title: For Iran and Hezbollah, calibrating response to Israeli strikes leaves no room for error

articles.author: RISHI LEKHI and RAFIQ MAQBOOL
articles.description: WAYANAD, India (AP) — Hopes of finding more than 180 missing people alive waned as rescue workers searched through mud and debris for a third day Thursday after landslides set off by torrential rains killed at least 194 people in southern India.
articles.title: Hopes of finding more survivors in the mud and debris wane after landslides in India kill 194

articles.author: SAMYA KULLAB
articles.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — In war-torn Ukraine, he is Alya Shabaanovich Gali, a popular doctor with a line of patients waiting to see him. To his family thousands of kilometers away in the besieged Gaza Strip, he is Alaa Shabaan Abu Ghali, the one who left.
articles.title: From Gaza to Kyiv, a Palestinian doctor lives between two wars

articles.author: STEVE PEOPLES, STEPHEN GROVES and MARC LEVY
articles.description: HARRISBURG, Pa. (AP) — Donald Trump is used to defending himself. But this week, the Republican presidential nominee has been put in the rare position of having to defend someone else — his running mate, Ohio Sen.
articles.title: Trump ramps up his defense of Vance after one of the rockiest VP rollouts in recent memory

articles.author: LINLEY SANDERS and SEUNG MIN KIM
articles.description: As Vice President Kamala Harris prepares to announce her running mate, a new poll from The Associated Press-NORC Center for Public Affairs Research finds that several of the top contenders for the role are largely unknown to Americans.
articles.title: What polling shows about the top VP contenders for Kamala Harris

articles.author: ELLEN KNICKMEYER, LARRY NEUMEISTER and MICHAEL R. SISAK
articles.description: WASHINGTON (AP) — Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, accused as the mastermind of al-Qaida’s Sept. 11, 2001, attacks on the United States, has agreed to plead guilty, the Defense Department said Wednesday.
articles.title: Khalid Sheikh Mohammed, accused as the main plotter of 9/11 attacks, agrees to plead guilty

articles.author: SARAH PARVINI
articles.description: LOS ANGELES (AP) — Hollywood's video game performers are heading to the Warner Bros. Studios lot Thursday to picket against what they call an unwillingness from top gaming companies to protect voice actors and motion capture workers equally against the unregulated use of artificial intelligence.
articles.title: Hollywood's video game performers head to the picket line over AI protections

articles.author: KANIS LEUNG
articles.description: HONG KONG (AP) — After spending five months in jail for publishing seditious Instagram posts, Joker Chan returned to a harsh reality.Chan, 30, was sentenced in 2022 for posts containing slogans like “Liberate Hong Kong, revolution of our times,” which were popularly chanted during massive anti-government protests in the city in 2019.
articles.title: Hong Kong young people struggle to rebuild their lives after being jailed under Beijing's crackdown

articles.author: PAUL NEWBERRY
articles.description: NANTERRE, France (AP) — Turns out, those comparisons to Michael Phelps weren't farfetched at all when it comes to Léon Marchand.They certainly weren't a burden for the 22-year-old Frenchman.
articles.title: Léon Marchand pulls off one of the most audacious doubles in swimming history at the Paris Olympics

articles.author: PAOLO SANTALUCIA
articles.description: CAMMARATA, Italy (AP) — On a scorching July afternoon, a municipal water truck rolls up in a cloud of dust on Liborio Mangiapane's farm in southern Sicily. Some of the precious liquid gets transferred to a smaller cistern on a tractor that Mangiapane's son will use to fill troughs for 250 cattle and sheep, but by tomorrow, all 10,000 liters from the truck will be gone.
articles.title: Extended drought parches Sicily, and farmers worry about being forced to sell off animals
